failed_to_update_email_notification_sett: Failed to update email notification setting
property_changes_description: Notify me when issue's properties like assignees, priority, estimates or anything else changes.
state_change_description: Notify me when the issues moves to a different state
issue_completed_description: Notify me only when an issue is completed
comments_description: Notify me when someone leaves a comment on the issue
mentions_description: Notify me only when someone mentions me in the comments or description
only_your_instance_admin_can_create_work: Only your instance admin can create workspaces
If you know your instance admin's email address, click the button below to get in touch with them.
workspace_could_not_be_created_please_tr: Workspace could not be created. Please try again.

workspaces_names_can_contain_only_space_: Workspaces names can contain only (' '), ('-'), ('_') and alphanumeric characters.
how_many_people_will_use_this_workspace: How many people will use this workspace?
how_many_people_will_use_this_workspace_: This will help us to determine the number of seats you need to purchase.
urls_can_contain_only_dash_and_alphanume: URLs can contain only ('-') and alphanumeric characters.
something_familiar_and_recognizable_is_a: Something familiar and recognizable is always best.
active_cycles_description: Monitor cycles across projects, track high-priority issues, and zoom in cycles that need attention.
on_demand_snapshots_of_all_your_cycles: On-demand snapshots of all your cycles
10000_feet_view_description: Zoom out to see running cycles across all your projects at once instead of going from Cycle to Cycle in each project.
get_snapshot_of_each_active_cycle: Get a snapshot of each active cycle.
get_snapshot_of_each_active_cycle_descri: Track high-level metrics for all active cycles, see their state of progress, and get a sense of scope against deadlines.
compare_burndowns_description: Monitor how each of your teams are performing with a peek into each cycle's burndown report.
quickly_see_make_or_break_issues_descrip: Preview high-priority issues for each cycle against due dates. See all of them per cycle in one click.
zoom_into_cycles_that_need_attention: Zoom into cycles that need attention.
zoom_into_cycles_that_need_attention_des: Investigate the state of any cycle that doesn't conform to expectations in one click.
stay_ahead_of_blockers_description: Spot challenges from one project to another and see inter-cycle dependencies that aren't obvious from any other view.
failed_to_remove_project_from_favorites: Couldn't remove the project from favorites. Please try again.
project_created_successfully_description: Project created successfully. You can now start adding issues to it.
title_should_be_less_than_255_characters: Title should be less than 255 characters
project_id_must_be_at_least_1_character: Project ID must at least be of 1 character
project_id_must_be_at_most_5_characters: Project ID must at most be of 5 characters
project_id_tooltip_content: Helps you identify issues in the project uniquely. Max 5 characters.
only_alphanumeric_non_latin_characters_a: Only Alphanumeric & Non-latin characters are allowed.
anyone_in_the_workspace_except_guests_ca: Anyone in the workspace except Guests can join
couldnt_add_the_project_to_favorites: Couldn't add the project to favorites. Please try again.
couldnt_remove_the_project_from_favorite: Couldn't remove the project from favorites. Please try again.
projects_and_issues_description: Toggle these on or off this project.
cycles_description: Timebox work as you see fit per project and change frequency from one period to the next.
modules_description: Group work into sub-project-like set-ups with their own leads and assignees.
views_description: Save sorts, filters, and display options for later or share them.
pages_description: Write anything like you write anything.
intake_description: Stay in the loop on Issues you are subscribed to. Enable this to get notified.
time_tracking_description: Track time spent on issues and projects.
work_management_description: Manage your work and projects with ease.
we_are_having_trouble_fetching_the_updat: We are having trouble fetching the updates.
please_select_at_least_one_invitation: Please select at least one invitation.

you_can_see_here_if_someone_invites_you_: You can see here if someone invites you to a workspace
deactivate_your_account_description: Once deactivated, you can't be assigned issues and be billed for your workspace. To reactivate your account, you will need an invite to a workspace at this email address.
editor_is_not_ready_to_discard_changes: Editor is not ready to discard changes

title: Title

team-blocking-relation-empty-state-descr: Good job! You have cleared the path for your team. You are a good team player.
team-blocked-relation-empty-state-title: You don’t have any teammate’s issues blocking you.
team-blocked-relation-empty-state-descri: Good news! You can make progress on all your assigned issues.
team-stats-empty-state-title: None of your linked projects have published issues.
team-stats-empty-state-description: Create some issues in one or more of those projects to see distribution of work by project and team members.
team-stats-filter-empty-state-title: There are no team stats for the filters applied.

importers.skip_user_import_description: Skipping user import will result in issues, comments, and other data from {serviceName} being created by the user performing the migration in Plane. You can still manually add users later.

jira_importer.jira_importer_description: Import your Jira data into Plane projects.
jira_importer.email_description: This is the email linked to your personal access token
jira_importer.jira_domain_description: This is the domain of your Jira instance

steps.description_configure_plane: Please first create the project in Plane where you intend to migrate your Jira data. Once the project is created, select it here.
steps.description_configure_jira: Please select the Jira workspace from which you want to migrate your data.
steps.description_import_users: Please add the users you wish to migrate from Jira to Plane. Alternatively, you can skip this step and manually add users later.
steps.description_map_states: We have automatically matched the Jira statuses to Plane states to the best of our ability. Please map any remaining states before proceeding, you can also create states and map them manually.
steps.description_map_priorities: We have automatically matched the priorities to the best of our ability. Please map any remaining priorities before proceeding.
steps.description_summary: Here is a summary of the data that will be migrated from Jira to Plane.

asana_importer.asana_importer_description: Import your Asana data into Plane projects.

steps.description_configure_plane: Please first create the project in Plane where you intend to migrate your Asana data. Once the project is created, select it here.
steps.description_configure_asana: Please select the Asana workspace and project from which you want to migrate your data.
steps.description_map_states: Please select the Asana states which you want to map to Plane project statuses.
steps.description_map_priorities: Please select the Asana priorities which you want to map to Plane project priorities.
steps.description_summary: Here is a summary of the data that will be migrated from Asana to Plane.

steps.description_configure_plane: Please first create the project in Plane where you intend to migrate your Linear data. Once the project is created, select it here.
steps.description_configure_linear: Please select the Linear team from which you want to migrate your data.
steps.description_map_states: We have automatically matched the Linear statuses to Plane states to the best of our ability. Please map any remaining states before proceeding, you can also create states and map them manually.
steps.description_map_priorities: Please select the Linear priorities which you want to map to Plane project priorities.
steps.description_summary: Here is a summary of the data that will be migrated from Linear to Plane.
